title: Online Collaborative Learning Design for Higher Education Partnerships

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Corporate science practitioner training conducted in smartphone-based limited-technology environments, operated with summative assessment focus

learning_goals: Learners can implement over three partnership-based problem-solving strategies through online collaboration with peer practitioners within four weeks
Learners can design and evaluate decision-making processes at least twice based on shared goals and responsibilities during project execution
Learners can establish a peer feedback system using smartphone-based tools (chat, simple file sharing, etc.) and maintain trust-based collaborative relationships with over 80% consistency

resources: Smartphone-Compatible Collaboration Platform (KakaoTalk, Google Drive Mobile Version, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
